content: The statement "Concentrates life and meaning into one desire value, for example-love" refers to the Knight of Infinite Resignation, who ultimately accepts the loss of a beloved object or goal but concentrates all their life and meaning into the memory and longing for that object. In this case, love serves as the ultimate desire value that gives meaning to their life, despite its absence or unattainability. The Knight of Infinite Resignation does not try to escape the pain or the loss, but instead embraces it as a necessary part of life and finds comfort in their commitment to their chosen value. This allows them to live a noble life that is centered around a meaningful purpose, even if it is based on a desire that can never be fully realized.
